content.raw: Using `tab_name` as a unique identifier is problematic as it relies on people ensuring their tab names are unique across plugins. A better option is to use the TabClass as the index to the settings dictionary. This does mean that if people want multiple instances of the one class, they run into problems, but that can be corrected in user code by creating stub subclasses in order to maintain each tab having a unique class. Does that makes sense?
